intro: Euphrasia officinalis subsp. minor, commonly known as lesser eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features small, yellowish-green flowers with two lips, characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairy and branching. The species is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine.
